TopicTitle: Titan hunter mk3: Thanks for 150 downloads

Articles.Content:
Hello people, after a long absence from the forums i have returned and i bring with me the first of many of the craft i have made for 0.90, my new Titan Hunter jet.

Edit:

Thanks for 150 downloads, this is officially one of my most popular craft to date

Titan Hunter mk3

Description:

My best effort at making a plane that handles like a dream, built for nothing other than pleasure this plane has no real use but who needs a purpose when the goal is fun?

Capable of over over 10g turns in the lower atmosphere while being completely unstallable without SAS enabled, do not be fooled though this baby is an air hogger, it will also do over 2250m/s in the upper atmosphere and can easily make its way into space without the aid of rockets.

Flight instructions:

It lifts off the ground at around 30-40m/s and is built with infini-gilde capabilities, you can glide this plane around the entire planet without engine power and engines are not required to land (or even take off if you have the patience to tap W and S repeatedly)

After that no flight instructions are needed, you can not stall this plane, at times you may think you have stalled it and lost control completely but if you release the controls it instantly corrects itself and SAS is only required if you are feeling lazy. (This makes this plane capable of some crazy acrobatics)

Download link: Part count 184

http://www./download/w3aad65c1qd17kf/Titan+Hunter+mk3.craft

Few pictures of it getting up to speed in the upper atmosphere.

Download link: Part count 184

http://www./download/w3aad65c1qd17kf/Titan+Hunter+mk3.craft

Edited February 20, 2015 by Roflcopterkklol

Edited January 21, 2015 by Roflcopterkklol

welkom back roflcopterkkklol nice plane

thanks man glad to be back at home

thanks man glad to be back at home

I had no idea you left xD Welcome back though.

But, back on topic, this Isn't the best handling plane in KSP o.o (Yeah i was shocked myself)

I tested my F-134 and your Titan Hunter MK3 side by side, landed them in front of SPH, that kind of thing, turns out- the F-134, i tried my very hardest, and couldn't get it to stall at all! Never lost control on it o.o !! Not trying to shoot your plane down (see what i did there?) just clearing things up

the Titan Hunter MK3 was easy for me to spin out, i did a couple aleron rolls while pressing S as hard as i could and five seconds later i hit the ground stalling D: (I hope i didn't hurt your feelings here! It was all in the name of SCIENCE! )

(F-134 Thread link: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/100814-Halco-Industries-F-134-stealth-fighter?highlight=F-134 )

Edited January 21, 2015 by Kozak

I had no idea you left xD Welcome back though.

But, back on topic, this Isn't the most maneuverable plane in KSP o.o (Yeah i was shocked myself)

I tested my F-134 and your Titan Hunter MK3 side by side, landed them in front of SPH, that kind of thing, turns out- the F-134, i tried my very hardest, and couldn't get it to stall at all! Never lost control on it o.o !! Not trying to shoot your plane down (see what i did there?) just clearing things up

the Titan Hunter MK3 was easy for me to spin out, i did a couple aleron rolls while pressing S as hard as i could and five seconds later i hit the ground stalling D: (I hope i didn't hurt your feelings here! It was all in the name of SCIENCE! )

(F-134 Thread link: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/100814-Halco-Industries-F-134-stealth-fighter?highlight=F-134 )

Well i tried the F-134 out, its a nice little plane i must say, very stable and i love the design on it but i am afraid it does not compare to my plane when it comes to sheer performance (Except for in loopty loops, that F-134 is nutty for loopty loops love it )

The only way i can see you being able to get it to actually stall is by turning the wing completely side on to the air flow while pitching either up or down half way through banking, and even if you do that all you have to do to correct the stall is let go of what ever controls you are using to make it stall and it stops.

I do show how to stall it in the video i am uploading and how it instantly stops once you stop trying to stall it

Edit:

I hope you don't mind me doing this but seen as your plane had a turbo jet on it i made it into an air hogger,

does 2000m/s now

Download link if you want to see what i did to it (basically slapped 7 shock cones inside it)

http://www./download/sm8xa8ewe5gem4k/F-134+high+alt.craft

Edited January 21, 2015 by Roflcopterkklol

The plane looks awesome and I may be using that tail design on my own planes, but as you are praising the performance you should probably take the hidden Elevon 4's out from behind the cockpit as they are inside the plane... I am all for reasonable clipping like the batteries inside the structural fuselage but control surfaces shouldn't be inside.

Damn this thing looks and feels nice, how many G can you pull out of it? (with joypad/stick axis of course)

but I think to answer the title's question NOOOO !!, you cant beat my 70Gs UMI (0.22)

Or Malcavelic (50Gs)

I like the design, but as the question best handling, its not a question of design, its just add more wings. Your design looks pretty good, but I could easily throw something together that is more maneuverable. Maneuverability isn't really limited, but at some point, Infiniglider will kick in. I know that, from experience, your jet isn't the most maneuverable, but really cool looking and maneuverable.

Damn 145 downloads

i think this is one of my most popular craft to date, only the SR-71/72 and b2 have been downloaded more.

Damn this thing looks and feels nice, how many G can you pull out of it? (with joypad/stick axis of course)

but I think to answer the title's question NOOOO !!, you cant beat my 70Gs UMI (0.22)

Or Malcavelic (50Gs)

I miss 0.22

for some reason you could make things just... idk in that version....

one of the first planes i built and its still better handling than anything since haha
